candidates.title: Implement automatic chat ID elicitation for MCP server
candidates.body:
## Summary

This PR implements automatic chat ID elicitation functionality for the VKTeams MCP server, eliminating the need for manual chat ID configuration.

* **Interactive Setup**: MCP server automatically requests chat ID from clients when first used
* **Session Management**: Chat IDs are cached per session with support for reset functionality  
* **Simplified API**: Removed chat_id parameters from all tool methods - handled automatically
* **Comprehensive Documentation**: Updated README with detailed usage examples and client integration
* **Robust Testing**: Added 4 specialized elicitation tests, 206 total tests passing

## Key Features

### Automatic Chat ID Resolution
- **Fallback Chain**: Parameter → Configuration → Session Cache → User Elicitation
- **Client Integration**: Works seamlessly with Claude Desktop, Continue, and other MCP clients
- **Session Persistence**: Chat ID remembered throughout the session
- **Reset Capability**: `reset_session` tool to clear cached data

### Breaking Changes
- **Removed** `chat_id` parameters from all tool method signatures
- Chat IDs now resolved automatically via elicitation when not configured
- Old chat_id parameters will be ignored if provided

### Enhanced User Experience
- **Zero Configuration**: No need to set `VKTEAMS_BOT_CHAT_ID` environment variable
- **Interactive Prompts**: User-friendly chat ID request with examples
- **Error Handling**: Comprehensive elicitation error management
- **Multi-Client Support**: Different clients can use different chat IDs

## Technical Implementation

- Added `ChatIdRequest` structure with JSON schema for elicitation
- Implemented `SessionState` with `Arc<RwLock<>>` for thread-safe session management
- Updated all 21 tool methods to use `get_or_elicit_chat_id()` function
- Added `convert_elicitation_error()` for proper MCP error responses
- Integrated `rmcp` elicitation features with `schemars` support

## Test Coverage

- **206 tests passing** (100% success rate)
- **74-88% code coverage** in core modules
- **0 clippy warnings** after fixes
- **4 new elicitation-specific tests** added

## Documentation

- Complete README overhaul with interactive setup instructions
- MCP client integration examples (Claude Desktop, Continue)
- Tool reference with updated parameter lists
- Session management workflow documentation

## Compatibility

- **MCP Protocol**: Fully compatible with MCP elicitation specification
- **Client Support**: Claude Desktop, Continue, and any MCP-compatible client
- **Backwards Compatibility**: Existing configurations still work seamlessly

This implementation significantly improves the developer experience by removing manual configuration steps while maintaining full functionality and performance.

Bumps the lock group with 9 updates in the / directory: | Package | From | To | | --- | --- | --- | | [tokio](https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio) | `1.46.0` | `1.46.1` | | [openai-api-rs](https://github.com/dongri/openai-api-rs) | `6.0.6` | `6.0.7` | | [clap](https://github.com/clap-rs/clap) | `4.5.40` | `4.5.41` | | [clap_complete](https://github.com/clap-rs/clap) | `4.5.54` | `4.5.55` | | [schemars](https://github.com/GREsau/schemars) | `0.9.0` | `1.0.3` | | [cc](https://github.com/rust-lang/cc-rs) | `1.2.28` | `1.2.29` | | [hyper-util](https://github.com/hyperium/hyper-util) | `0.1.14` | `0.1.15` | | [rustls](https://github.com/rustls/rustls) | `0.23.28` | `0.23.29` | | [sdd](https://github.com/wvwwvwwv/scalable-delayed-dealloc) | `3.0.8` | `3.0.9` | Updates `tokio` from 1.46.0 to 1.46.1
Release notes

Sourced from tokio's releases.

Tokio v1.46.1

1.46.1 (July 4th, 2025)

This release fixes incorrect spawn locations in runtime task hooks for tasks spawned using tokio::spawn rather than Runtime::spawn. This issue only effected the spawn location in TaskMeta::spawned_at, and did not effect task locations in Tracing events.

Unstable

  • runtime: add TaskMeta::spawn_location tracking where a task was spawned (#7440)

#7440: tokio-rs/tokio#7440

Commits
  • ab3ff69 chore: prepare to release v1.46.1 (#7444)
  • a0d5b8a runtime(unstable): fix task hook spawn locations for tokio::spawn (#7440)
  • a1ee3ef chore: fix some minor typos in the comments (#7442)
  • 171cd14 changelog: fix typo in pipe::OpenOptions for 1.46.0 (#7439)
  • See full diff in compare view

Updates `schemars` from 0.9.0 to 1.0.3
Release notes

Sourced from schemars's releases.

v1.0.3

Fixed

  • Fix compile error when a doc comment is set on both a transparent (or newtype) struct and its field (GREsau/schemars#446)
  • Fix json_schema!() macro compatibility when used from pre-2021 rust editions (GREsau/schemars#447)

v1.0.2

Fixed

  • Fix schema properties being incorrectly reordered during serialization (GREsau/schemars#444)

v1.0.1

Fixed

  • Deriving JsonSchema with no_std broken due to std::borrow::ToOwned trait not being in scope (GREsau/schemars#441)

v1.0.0

This is a major release with many additions, fixes and changes since 0.8 (but not many since 0.9). While the basic usage (deriving JsonSchema and using schema_for!() or SchemaGenerator) is mostly unchanged, you may wish to consult the migration guide which covers some of the most significant changes.

Changes since 1.0.0-rc.2:

Added

  • #[schemars(bound = ...)] attributes are now used from fields as well as containers
  • The Schema::pointer(...) method now works when given a JSON pointer in URI Fragment representation with a leading # character. In particular, this means that you can now lookup a schema from a $ref value using that method.

Fixed

  • Schema names that contain special characters are now correctly encoded when used inside a $ref value (GREsau/schemars#436)
  • Optimise type param usage in SchemaGenerator::subschema_for, reducing LLVM line count and improving compile times (GREsau/schemars#439)

v1.0.0-rc.2

Added

  • Serde attributes that you want schemars to ignore can now be "unset" by including them in a schemars attribute with a ! prefix, e.g. #[schemars(!from)] (GREsau/schemars#433 / GREsau/schemars#434)

Removed

  • ⚠️ Deprecated items have been removed:
    • SchemaSettings::option_nullable and SchemaSettings::option_add_null_type fields
    • gen module

v1.0.0-rc.1

Added

  • Impl JsonSchema for chrono::TimeDelta (GREsau/schemars#357)
  • Support with/into/from/try_from container attributes (GREsau/schemars#210 / GREsau/schemars#267)

Changed

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from schemars's changelog.

[1.0.3] - 2025-06-28

Fixed

  • Fix compile error when a doc comment is set on both a transparent (or newtype) struct and its field (GREsau/schemars#446)
  • Fix json_schema!() macro compatibility when used from pre-2021 rust editions (GREsau/schemars#447)

[1.0.2] - 2025-06-26

Fixed

  • Fix schema properties being incorrectly reordered during serialization (GREsau/schemars#444)

[1.0.1] - 2025-06-24

Fixed

  • Deriving JsonSchema with no_std broken due to std::borrow::ToOwned trait not being in scope (GREsau/schemars#441)

[1.0.0] - 2025-06-23

This is a major release with many additions, fixes and changes since 0.8 (but not many since 0.9). While the basic usage (deriving JsonSchema and using schema_for!() or SchemaGenerator) is mostly unchanged, you may wish to consult the migration guide which covers some of the most significant changes.

Changes since 1.0.0-rc.2:

Added

  • #[schemars(bound = ...)] attributes are now used from fields as well as containers
  • The Schema::pointer(...) method now works when given a JSON pointer in URI Fragment representation with a leading # character. In particular, this means that you can now lookup a schema from a $ref value using that method.

Fixed

  • Schema names that contain special characters are now correctly encoded when used inside a $ref value (GREsau/schemars#436)
  • Optimise type param usage in SchemaGenerator::subschema_for, reducing LLVM line count and improving compile times (GREsau/schemars#439)

[1.0.0-rc.2] - 2025-06-19

Added

  • Serde attributes that you want schemars to ignore can now be "unset" by including them in a schemars attribute with a ! prefix, e.g. #[schemars(!from)] (GREsau/schemars#433 / GREsau/schemars#434)

Removed

  • ⚠️ Deprecated items have been removed:
    • SchemaSettings::option_nullable and SchemaSettings::option_add_null_type fields
    • gen module

[1.0.0-rc.1] - 2025-06-16

Added

... (truncated)

Commits
  • e235dbb v1.0.3
  • 167edf3 Accept comments on both transparent struct and its field (#448)
  • 75f670a Improve json_schema!-macro compability with older rust editions (#447)
  • 2697ecb v1.0.2
  • d3d96b6 Improve handling of keyword ordering in schema serialization (#445)
  • d8efe53 Delete broken symlinks
  • 0c38f5f v1.0.1
  • 092e971 Simplify docs.rs links
  • 98a707d Fix deriving with no_std (#442)
  • 0134a2e Remove v1 alpha notes
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

Updates `hyper-util` from 0.1.14 to 0.1.15
Release notes

Sourced from hyper-util's releases.

v0.1.15

tl;dr

  • Add header casing options to auto::Builder.
  • Fix proxy::Socksv5 to check for enough bytes before parsing ipv6 responses.
  • Fix including client-proxy in the full feature set.

What's Changed

  • ci: pin tracing-core in msrv job by @​seanmonstar in hyperium/hyper-util#203
  • Cleanup deadcode in client by @​howardjohn in hyperium/hyper-util#202

  • refactor: include client-proxy in full feature by @​seanmonstar in hyperium/hyper-util#206
  • refactor(client): remove old body delay_eof code by @​seanmonstar in hyperium/hyper-util#208
  • feat(builder): support header case methods by @​AndreyErmilov in hyperium/hyper-util#207

New Contributors

Updates `rustls-webpki` from 0.103.3 to 0.103.4
Release notes

Sourced from rustls-webpki's releases.

0.103.4

  • Add unstable support for the post-quantum ML-DSA signature algorithms when using aws-lc-rs. Enable the aws-lc-rs-unstable feature to expose these algorithms (only works when aws-lc-rs-fips is not enabled).
  • Use new UnsupportedSignatureAlgorithmContext, UnsupportedCrlSignatureAlgorithmContext, UnsupportedSignatureAlgorithmForPublicKeyContext and UnsupportedCrlSignatureAlgorithmForPublicKeyContext error variants which contain additional context about the error condition. The related contextless variants have been deprecated.

What's Changed

  • Do not include bettertls README file in published crates by @​decathorpe in rustls/webpki#351
  • deps: Update aws-lc-rs in lockfile by @​ognevny in rustls/webpki#355
  • Inline signature verifications test macros by @​djc in rustls/webpki#358
  • ci: test more feature flag combinations by @​djc in rustls/webpki#359
  • Add unstable support for ML-DSA signature algorithms by @​djc in rustls/webpki#348
  • Add context to signature-related errors by @​djc in rustls/webpki#357
  • Upgrade to rcgen 0.14 by @​djc in rustls/webpki#363
  • Declare ML-DSA as not FIPS approved in the API by @​ctz in rustls/webpki#364
  • Bump version to 0.103.4 by @​djc in rustls/webpki#361
Commits
  • 6793504 Make new error context types public
  • 4831218 Bump version to 0.103.4
  • 312d3de Declare ML-DSA as not FIPS approved in the API
  • 5ea4b9b Use test documentation as docstring
  • 785e876 Impose more structure on candidate path rejection test
  • 46b9143 Upgrade to rcgen 0.14
  • 44dfe42 Apply suggestions from clippy 1.88
  • cbd72bc Add context for unsupported signature algorithm for public key errors
  • a751a47 Add context for unsupported signature algorithm errors
  • 8264e66 Allow enum variant deprecations
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

candidates.title: Refactor MCP server to eliminate environment variable duplication
candidates.body:
- Modified CliBridge::new() to accept UnifiedConfig instead of reading env vars directly
- Removed chat_id field from Server struct - now using config.mcp.chat_id
- Eliminated duplicate VKTEAMS_BOT_CHAT_ID reading between Server and CliBridge
- Added support for config.mcp.cli_path to specify CLI binary location
- Updated all tests to use new CliBridge API
- Centralized configuration handling in UnifiedConfig with apply_env_overrides()
- Added dirs dependency for better user config path resolution

All tests pass (158/158) and code compiles successfully.

candidates.title: Optimize MCP server architecture with direct result conversion
candidates.body:
Add McpCliBridge trait that returns MCPResult directly, eliminating intermediate convert_bridge_result calls in server methods. All 26 Server methods now use streamlined _mcp methods instead of two-step conversion pattern.

Changes:
- Add mcp_bridge_trait module with McpCliBridge trait
- Implement McpCliBridge for CliBridge with inline conversion
- Replace all Server methods to use direct _mcp calls
- Make convert_bridge_result pub(crate) for internal use only
- Maintain 100% test coverage (78/78 tests passing)

Performance improvements:
- Reduced function call overhead in hot paths
- Eliminated redundant result handling
- Cleaner, more maintainable code structure

candidates.title: Add comprehensive storage functionality with PostgreSQL and vector search
candidates.body:
…arch

Features:
- PostgreSQL storage with sqlx integration
- Vector similarity search using pgvector
- AI embeddings support (OpenAI and Ollama)
- CLI storage commands for database management
- Unified configuration system integration
- Full-text search capabilities
- Event and message storage with retention policies
- Batch processing and performance optimizations
- Comprehensive test coverage including integration tests
- Configuration example with all storage options

Technical improvements:
- Feature-gated compilation for optional storage components
- Trait-based architecture for extensible vector stores
- Error handling with custom storage error types
- Migration system for database schema management
- Health checks and monitoring capabilities
- Testcontainers integration for reliable testing

candidates.title: Performance
candidates.body:
This PR improves performance across the project by introducing parallel event processing, refining retry/backoff logic for file uploads, and adding extensive benchmarks and async optimizations for configuration and scheduler operations.

    Enhanced async and parallel processing for longpoll event handling.
    Refactored network functions with improved retryable file upload and adaptive backoff.
    Added benchmarks and tests to measure performance for rate limiting, config management, and scheduler operations.

candidates.title: add gRPC health reporter server
candidates.body:
Make health reporter for gRPC
https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/health-checking.md

supported in Kubernetes by default
https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/configure-liveness-readiness-startup-probes/#define-a-grpc-liveness-probe

chosen_pr.title: Bump slab from 0.4.10 to 0.4.11
chosen_pr.body:
Bumps [slab](https://github.com/tokio-rs/slab) from 0.4.10 to 0.4.11.
Release notes

Sourced from slab's releases.

v0.4.11

  • Fix Slab::get_disjoint_mut out of bounds (#152)
Changelog

Sourced from slab's changelog.

0.4.11 (August 8, 2025)

  • Fix Slab::get_disjoint_mut out of bounds (#152)
Commits

  • 2d65c51 Fix get_disjoint_mut error condition (#152)

You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/bug-ops/vkteams-bot/network/alerts).
